page.title: 15Changing Industry
page.content: The original industry was located along Bradshaw and Eagley Brooks using water power.There were bleachworks at Bradshaw and Meeting o' the Waters, a cotton mill at Eagley and a paper mill at Hall ith Wood.The cotton mill later changed to coal power. Most of the Bradshaw works is no longer in use whilst Eagley mill has been divided up into units,having closed as a cotton mill in the 1960's. Walmesley's paper mill is now found on the Meeting o' the Waters site. Little other industry exists in the area.A painting restoration firm have taken over the old council offices at Bromley Cross and a timber mill is sited on the side of Bradshaw Brook. Quarries of millstone grit,used as a building stone, are found at Hardy Mill but are now closed and are being filled in as tips.
